name: Steveston and beyond
description: This is a tour to explore one of the historcal facades of Vancouver along the Frazer river. The whole of the hike is some eight km from Finn Slough to Garry Point Park. It appeals to a variety of interests from 19th Century Farm estate that belonged to British Settles to early 20th century Japanese shipbuliding families that disapeared during the war.  It can be customized in a number of fashions. Such as a lunch break at Steveston Fisherman's Wharf or A brunch or tea time at London Heritage farm.
